page.title: 17CLUBS CLAPHAM CONTINUED
page.content: exhibits.It started in 1950.They have had 34 exhibitions.It is the second oldest club in Clapham. The Photographic Club is also held in the Reading Room.They show other people in the group photographs they have taken and they sometimes go out and take photographs together.People come into the group to learn how to take photos and how to develop them. . W.E.A stands for Workers Educational Assocation .It is a course about local history for local people around the area.A speaker comes in and talks about local history.It is also held in the school. The Women's Institute meets in the village hall on the second Wednesday in the month at 7.30pm.There are often visiting speakers and demonstrations. Thursday Special is a bible club connected with the Bethel Chapel.
